Hey! I have an idea which might help us along maybe? Anyway, I am
guilty of this as well so i think this applies to us all. Typically
one of us will say:

Rodimus Prime steps around the corner, and seeing the battle opens FIRE!

That sounds good, but since none of know who is being targeted none on
the opposing side reacts.

We could just simply state who we are targeting, and then hopefully
this will keep things orderly?

'Rodimus Prime steps around the corner, and seeing the battle, targets
Hydras, and opens FIRE!'

If you wanted to you could even add an OOC at the bottom stating it in
very simple terms, since some of us (like me) can be very wordy, and
the true meaning of things can get lost.

For example:

*************************************************

Rodimus Prime stepped around the corner, his optics brightening at the
battle before him. Ducking down, to avoid a shot from one of the
Decepticons, he smiled to himself as he glanced around the corner
again and saw Hydras standing in the middle of things giving order.

"I got you now." Rodimus said to himself as he crouched down and
oriented his weapon on the the multi-headed monstrosity that was
Hydras! The smallest click could be heard as Rodimus pulls the trigger
sending a tremendous surge of power through the orifice of his gun at
Hydras, the weapon bucking slightly as the energy left the barrel!

OOC: Rodimus dodges weapons fire, ducks low and fires on Hydras with
his laser blaster

*************************************************

Does that make sense? I will probrably implement it on my own posts,
but what are everyone else thoughts?

Of course the above was only an example, and not an IC post :)

Preston
